definition: to explode or burst/to quick fry or quick boil

sentences.english: Watching yourself give a presentation can give you a tremendous confidence boost.
sentences.chinese: 觀看自己的演講可以使你的自信心瞬間爆棚。

sentences.english: News, on-line related commentary in a short time full house.
sentences.chinese: 消息一出，網上相關評論在短時間內爆棚。

sentences.english: I bragged to my sister, mother, and boyfriend about this.
sentences.chinese: 我自信心爆棚，跟姐姐媽媽和男朋友都炫耀了一番。

sentences.english: The young man is played with charm and supreme self-confidence by Ewan McGregor.
sentences.chinese: 這年輕人由伊雲麥葵格飾演，迷人兼自信心爆棚。

sentences.english: Are you bursting with new and innovative ideas?
sentences.chinese: 你爆棚新的和創新的想法？

sentences.english: Example: The movie theater was so crowded that getting a seat was like finding a needle in a haystack.
sentences.chinese: 電影院大爆棚，想找到一個座位可謂大海撈針。

sentences.english: The team recently re-take three in a row, confidence can be said that overflowed the.
sentences.chinese: 而球隊近期也再取三連勝，信心可以說是爆棚了。
現在我感覺自己信心爆棚。

definition: off the charts/extreme/beyond the normal range of measurement
ample/complete/hundred percent/a pure shade (of some color)
(neologism c. 2009) don't worry, it's all taken care of
full working hours/full marks/perfect score/(fig.) (after a attribute) couldn't be more (happy, romantic etc)
first-rate/excellent (loanword from Japanese 一番, ichiban)
to surge up/to rise/(of tensions etc) to run high
